intro: Taraxacum lunglungense, commonly known as the Lunglung dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically hairy and lobed, with a rough texture. Its yellow flowers develop into fluffy white seed heads, typical of the dandelion genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
